page.title: 16OPPOSITION,BEWICK TRUST PLAN
page.content: Opposition from many Mickley residents who are strongly in favour of the restoration of the Birthplace but without further enlargement. First planning application rejected.It had included provision for a car and coach park necessitating use of a road in Mickley considered unsuitable.It is too narrow for coaches to pass each other. Also, leading from the A69, it is a no-through road thus doubling the volume of traffic. In this application the Trust had sought facilities for an estimated 11000 visitors each year. Third planning application successful. Regarded by many as watered down version of the first. Residents still fear that the first application is the scheme which the Trust finally hopes to secure. { {Mr. P. Brown,}representing residents opposing planning application. {
